'''Methed-en-glad''' was a stronghold of [[Dor-Cúarthol]] at the edge of the forest south of the [[Crossings of the Taeglin]].<ref>{{CH|List}}, entry Methed-en-glad</ref>

== History ==
The stronghold of Methed-en-glad was one of the many guarded camps and fortresses that were established around the [[House of Ransom|Echad i Sedryn]] during the brief existence of [[Dor-Cúarthol]], the realm ruled by the [[Two Captains]]. It was said that from Methed-en-glad, there was a view to the south where the summit of Amon Rûdh could be seen and commands and messages could be received to and from both locations through signals.<ref>{{CH|8}}, p. 145</ref><ref>{{UT|2o}}</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Methed-en-glad'' is a [[Sindarin]] name meaning "the End of the Wood", derived from ''[[methed]]'' ("end") + ''[[en]]'' ("of the") + ''[[glad]]'' ("wood").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-60924579.html|articlename=S. ''Methed-en-glad'' loc.|website=[[Eldamo]]|accessed=29 August 2022}}</ref><ref>{{VT|48a}}, p. 15 (note 7)</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names|articlename=Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth|dated=|website=[http://www.tolkiendil.com Tolkiendil.com]|accessed=22 January 2012}}</ref>
